title: Tag Manager API

list.description: Lists all GTM Accounts that a user has access to.

fingerprint.description:
When provided, this fingerprint must match the fingerprint of the account
in storage.

list.description: Lists all Containers that belongs to a GTM Account.

fingerprint.description:
When provided, this fingerprint must match the fingerprint of the
container in storage.

update.description: Moves entities to a GTM Folder.

triggerId.description: The triggers to be moved to the folder.

variableId.description: The variables to be moved to the folder.

tagId.description: The tags to be moved to the folder.

list.description: Lists all Container Versions of a GTM Container.

includeDeleted.description: Also retrieve deleted (archived) versions when true.

restore.description:
Restores a Container Version. This will overwrite the container's current
configuration (including its variables, triggers and tags). The operation
will not have any effect on the version that is being served (i.e. the
published version).

containerVersionId.description: The GTM Container Version ID. Specify published to retrieve the currently published version.

fingerprint.description:
When provided, this fingerprint must match the fingerprint of the
container version in storage.

When provided, this fingerprint must match the fingerprint of the
container version in storage.

list.description: Lists all GTM Variables of a Container.

fingerprint.description:
When provided, this fingerprint must match the fingerprint of the variable
in storage.

list.description: Lists all GTM Environments of a GTM Container.

fingerprint.description:
When provided, this fingerprint must match the fingerprint of the
environment in storage.

update.description: Re-generates the authorization code for a GTM Environment.

list.description: Lists all GTM Folders of a Container.

fingerprint.description:
When provided, this fingerprint must match the fingerprint of the folder in
storage.

list.description: List all entities in a GTM Folder.
Lists all GTM Triggers of a Container.

fingerprint.description:
When provided, this fingerprint must match the fingerprint of the trigger
in storage.

list.description: Lists all GTM Tags of a Container.

fingerprint.description:
When provided, this fingerprint must match the fingerprint of the tag in
storage.

list.description:
List all users that have access to the account along with Account and
Container Permissions granted to each of them.

get.description: Gets a user's Account & Container Permissions.

update.description: Updates a user's Account & Container Permissions.

create.description: Creates a user's Account & Container Permissions.

delete.description:
Removes a user from the account, revoking access to it and all of its
containers.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

description:
This API allows clients to access and modify container and tag
     configuration.

tags.description: All GTM Tags of a GTM Container.

triggers.description: All GTM Triggers of a GTM Container.

stopOnSetupFailure.description:
If true, fire the main tag if and only if the setup tag fires
successfully.
If false, fire the main tag regardless of setup tag firing status.

tagName.description: The name of the setup tag.

name.description: The name of the container version to be created.

quickPreview.description:
The creation of this version may be for quick preview and
shouldn't be saved.

notes.description: The notes of the container version to be created.

Rule.description: Represents a Google Tag Manager Rule.

ruleId.description: The Rule ID uniquely identifies the GTM Rule.

fingerprint.description:
The fingerprint of the GTM Rule as computed at storage time.
This value is recomputed whenever the rule is modified.

ContainerVersion.description: Represents a Google Tag Manager Container Version.

macro.description: The macros in the container that this version was taken from.

tag.description: The tags in the container that this version was taken from.

variable.description: The variables in the container that this version was taken from.

fingerprint.description:
The fingerprint of the GTM Container Version as computed at
storage time. This value is recomputed whenever the container version is
modified.

deleted.description: A value of true indicates this container version has been deleted.

containerVersionId.description: The Container Version ID uniquely identifies the GTM Container Version.

trigger.description: The triggers in the container that this version was taken from.

rule.description: The rules in the container that this version was taken from.

folder.description: The folders in the container that this version was taken from.

container.description: The container that this version was taken from.

Container.description: Represents a Google Tag Manager Container.

enabledBuiltInVariable.description: List of enabled built-in variables. Valid values include: pageUrl, pageHostname, pagePath, referrer, event, clickElement, clickClasses, clickId, clickTarget, clickUrl, clickText, formElement, formClasses, formId, formTarget, formUrl, formText, errorMessage, errorUrl, errorLine, newHistoryFragment, oldHistoryFragment, newHistoryState, oldHistoryState, historySource, containerVersion, debugMode, randomNumber, containerId. @mutable tagmanager.accounts.containers.create @mutable tagmanager.accounts.containers.update

containerId.description: The Container ID uniquely identifies the GTM Container.

fingerprint.description:
The fingerprint of the GTM Container as computed at storage time.  This
value is recomputed whenever the account is modified.

The fingerprint of the GTM Variable as computed at storage time.
This value is recomputed whenever the variable is modified.

variableId.description: The Variable ID uniquely identifies the GTM Variable.

Variable.description: Represents a Google Tag Manager Variable.

userAccess.description: All GTM AccountUsers of a GTM Account.

tagName.description: The name of the teardown tag.

stopTeardownOnFailure.description:
If true, fire the teardown tag if and only if the main tag fires
successfully.
If false, fire the teardown tag regardless of main tag firing status.

teardownTag.description: The list of teardown tags. Currently we only allow one.

setupTag.description: The list of setup tags. Currently we only allow one.

enumDescriptions: Tag can be fired multiple times per event.

Tag can only be fired per event but can be fired multiple times per load
(e.g., app load or page load).
Tag can only be fired per load (e.g., app load or page load).

fingerprint.description:
The fingerprint of the GTM Tag as computed at storage time.
This value is recomputed whenever the tag is modified.

tagId.description: The Tag ID uniquely identifies the GTM Tag.

Tag.description: Represents a Google Tag Manager Tag.

ContainerAccess.description: Defines the Google Tag Manager Container access permissions.

folders.description: All GTM Folders of a GTM Container.

Parameter.description: Represents a Google Tag Manager Parameter.

type.description:
The parameter type. Valid values are:
  • boolean: The value represents a boolean, represented as 'true' or 'false'
  • integer: The value represents a 64-bit signed integer value, in base 10
  • list: A list of parameters should be specified
  • map: A map of parameters should be specified
  • template: The value represents any text; this can include variable references (even variable references that might return non-string types)
  • trigger_reference: The value represents a trigger, represented as the trigger id
  • tag_reference: The value represents a tag, represented as the tag name
@mutable tagmanager.accounts.containers.variables.create @mutable tagmanager.accounts.containers.variables.update @mutable tagmanager.accounts.containers.triggers.create @mutable tagmanager.accounts.containers.triggers.update @mutable tagmanager.accounts.containers.tags.create @mutable tagmanager.accounts.containers.tags.update

Account.description: Represents a Google Tag Manager Account.

fingerprint.description:
The fingerprint of the GTM Account as computed at storage time.
This value is recomputed whenever the account is modified.

accountId.description: The Account ID uniquely identifies the GTM Account.

AccountAccess.description: Defines the Google Tag Manager Account access permissions.

containerVersionHeader.description: All container version headers of a GTM Container.

containerVersion.description: All versions of a GTM Container.

Folder.description: Represents a Google Tag Manager Folder.

fingerprint.description:
The fingerprint of the GTM Folder as computed at storage time.
This value is recomputed whenever the folder is modified.

folderId.description: The Folder ID uniquely identifies the GTM Folder.

environments.description: All Environments of a GTM Container.

Macro.description: Represents a Google Tag Manager Macro.

fingerprint.description:
The fingerprint of the GTM Macro as computed at storage time.
This value is recomputed whenever the macro is modified.

macroId.description: The Macro ID uniquely identifies the GTM Macro.

parameter.description:
A list of named parameters (key/value), depending on the condition's type. Notes:
  • For binary operators, include parameters named arg0 and arg1 for specifying the left and right operands, respectively.
  • At this time, the left operand (arg0) must be a reference to a variable.
  • For case-insensitive Regex matching, include a boolean parameter named ignore_case that is set to true. If not specified or set to any other value, the matching will be case sensitive.
  • To negate an operator, include a boolean parameter named negate boolean parameter that is set to true.
@mutable tagmanager.accounts.containers.triggers.create @mutable tagmanager.accounts.containers.triggers.update

UserAccess.description: Represents a user's permissions to an account and its container.

variables.description: All GTM Variables of a GTM Container.

trigger.description: The list of triggers inside the folder.

variable.description: The list of variables inside the folder.

tag.description: The list of tags inside the folder.

FolderEntities.description: Represents a Google Tag Manager Folder's contents.

Trigger.description: Represents a Google Tag Manager Trigger

triggerId.description: The Trigger ID uniquely identifies the GTM Trigger.

uniqueTriggerId.description:
Globally unique id of the trigger that auto-generates this (a Form Submit,
Link Click or Timer listener) if any. Used to make incompatible auto-events
work together with trigger filtering based on trigger ids. This value is
populated during output generation since the tags implied by triggers don't
exist until then. Only valid for Form Submit, Link Click and Timer
triggers.
@mutable tagmanager.accounts.containers.triggers.create
@mutable tagmanager.accounts.containers.triggers.update

fingerprint.description:
The fingerprint of the GTM Trigger as computed at storage time.
This value is recomputed whenever the trigger is modified.

accounts.description: List of GTM Accounts that a user has access to.

ContainerVersionHeader.description: Represents a Google Tag Manager Container Version Header.

numRules.description: Number of rules in the container version.

containerVersionId.description: The Container Version ID uniquely identifies the GTM Container Version.

numVariables.description: Number of variables in the container version.

numMacros.description: Number of macros in the container version.

numTriggers.description: Number of triggers in the container version.

numTags.description: Number of tags in the container version.

deleted.description: A value of true indicates this container version has been deleted.

containers.description: All Containers of a GTM Account.

Environment.description:
Represents a Google Tag Manager Environment. Note that a user can create,
delete and update environments of type USER, but can only update the
enable_debug and url fields of environments of other types.

environmentId.description: GTM Environment ID uniquely identifies the GTM Environment.

enumDescriptions:
Used for Live environment, which points to the live published container
version.

Used for Latest environment, which points to the latest created container
version.

Used for Draft environment, which points to the single draft in
the container.

fingerprint.description:
The fingerprint of the GTM environment as computed at storage time.
This value is recomputed whenever the environment is modified.

authorizationTimestampMs.description: The last update time-stamp for the authorization code.

https://www.googleapis.com/auth/tagmanag.description: View your Google Tag Manager container and its subcomponents
Manage user permissions of your Google Tag Manager account and container
Manage your Google Tag Manager container versions
View and manage your Google Tag Manager accounts
Delete your Google Tag Manager containers
Manage your Google Tag Manager container and its subcomponents, excluding versioning and publishing
Publish your Google Tag Manager container versions
